alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 10:11PM EDT until June 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Tuesday was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.8 feet on 05/12/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.7 Tue 9 pm 5.2 4.4 5.8 2am 6/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 200 AM EDT.
